oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Potential use of recombinant bovine interferon-Alphal1 in the control of bovine respiratory disease in fattening calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Martinod, S.
McCullough, K.
Miozzari, G.
Steiger, R. F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: calf diseases
calves
cattle diseases
Immunotherapy
Interferon
Recombination
Respiratory diseases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interferons (IFNs) are a group of proteins which control virus replication, exhibit anti-proliferative effectson cells, and modulate immune effector cell functions. The results of five semi-field trials summarized in the present article demonstrate that rBoIFN-Î±l1 affords significant protection to fattening calves against natural outbreaks of ECP. The product has proved to be similarly promising in the control of shipping fever under North American feedlot conditions.
